titleStmt.title: W. W. Tise and C. T. Marshall to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5437

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To H. Excellency Thos E. Bramblette,
Gov of Kentucky.
Governor

Hon R. K. Williams who will hand you this note will explain it Mr Paine was at the present term of the court conficted of keeping a gaming home upon evidence of playing for treats and although the conviction was in my judgment according to law & evidence yet this seems to be a hard case on Paine who is a worthy gentleman and he alone is indicted and tried when probably every saloon keeper in the county is equaly guilty, and more worthy of punishment than Mr Paine I therefore request if it seems proper and consistent with your executive discretion that you look favorably upon Mr Paines case

Yours &c
W. W. Tise Comths atty
1st J. D.
C. T. Marshall Judge
